match.title: 4th ODI
match.statusText: England won by 5 wickets (with 19 balls remaining)

image.caption: A general view of the redeveloped R Premadasa Stadium
image.longCaption: A general view of the redeveloped R Premadasa Stadium, Basnahira v Wayamba, SLC Inter-provisional limited-over tournament, Colombo, 23 January 2011

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00 Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

headshotImage.caption: RS Bopara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RS Bopara headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Bopara b Broad 69 (102b 4x4 0x6 171m) SR: 67.64

dismissalComment.html: short again, and pulled straight down the throat of deep square leg! That was a sucker punch - it was nothing more than a leg-stump long-hop, and could have done anywhere. Broad looks suitably sheepish, but that's a big wicket for England

headshotImage.longCaption: SCJ Broad headshot

headshotImage.caption: RS Bopara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RS Bopara headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva c Bopara b Broad 67 (101b 5x4 0x6 133m) SR: 66.33

dismissalComment.html: a wide bouncer and Silva uppercuts this down to third man. Bopara runs six or seven metres around the boundary to take an excellent running catch at a comfortable height

headshotImage.caption: Ryan Sidebottom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan Sidebottom player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: WU Tharanga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: WU Tharanga headshot

dismissalComment.html: gone! Reward for Sidebottom's excellent control this morning as he finds another away-swinger which leaves Tharanga at the very last moment, handing first slip a comfortable catch at waist height

headshotImage.caption: Chaminda Vaas player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chaminda Vaas player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: a low inswinging full-toss, and Sidebottom strikes! That was an attempted yorker, overpitched and Vaas was onto it in a flash. But Pietersen at short midwicket had no need to move, and toppled over backwards as the ball thudded into his chest

headshotImage.caption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: good bowling. A well-directed yorker, Mubarak stepped across to use the pace and sweep through fine leg, but he missed it entirely and lost his middle stump

headshotImage.caption: JM Anderson headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: JM Anderson headshot

headshotImage.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: got him! A fine piece of bowling - the slower ball which Jayasuriya misread and attempted to chip over mid-off. Pietersen nearly made a complete cabbage of it, but took it face height at the second attempt

headshotImage.caption: DPMD Jayawardene headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: DPMD Jayawardene headshot

dismissalComment.html: another one bites the dust! Banged in short, Jayawardene slashed hard outside off stump, but he got a fraction underneath the ball, and Stuart Broad at third man took a fine and fast catch. Problems mounting for Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: TM Dilshan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: TM Dilshan headshot

dismissalComment.html: full length, nearly a yorker, and that's the end of that. Dilshan went to mow a meadow, missed, and was bowled through his legs. Still, a useful little cameo

dismissalText.commentary: Kaushal Lokuarachchi lbw b Collingwood 9 (10b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: perfect line and length, noticeably quicker as well, and Lokuarachchi was beaten all ends up as he aimed a flick to leg. Well bowled, and the umpire's finger was up with Shakoor Rana-esque speed. That was plumb

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook b Fernando 80 (123b 6x4 0x6 189m) SR: 65.04

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Cook is furious with himself. Short of a length outside his off stump, Cook tries to cut this but it's too short and he chops it on. He swings his bat in utter disbelief

commentTextItems.html: and there it is! England win the series 3-1 as he just whips this leg-side delivery down to fine-leg. Pietersen runs through and jumps in the air in delight, pumping his fist. He's found form at last and has taken England through to not only an impressive win today, but an excellent series victory

commentPostTextItems.html: Paul Collingwood and the rest of the England team come out to greet Pietersen and to shake the hands of Sri Lanka's players. England take the series 3-1 - what an effort it has been. It is their first major series win in the subcontinent since 1987 and their first ever win in Sri Lanka. We hope you've enjoyed our coverage today. From Will Luke, Martin Williamson and Andrew Miller, it's goodnight - and do join us for the final game on Saturday.

commentTextItems.html: and the scores are level as he flicks this one to midwicket
flicked through midwicket
a full toss, pushed through midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: Four needed. Jayasuriya into the attack

commentTextItems.html: Pietersen skips down the pitch and bunts it back to the bowler
solidly defended by Bopara in the end but a cracking ball with which to end the over, swinging into the right hander at the last moment

headshotImage.caption: RS Bopara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RS Bopara headshot

headshotImage.caption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: SL Malinga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SL Malinga headshot

headshotImage.caption: Dilhara Fernando player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dilhara Fernando player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: fast, but misdirected. Bopara pats it to leg

dismissalText.commentary: Owais Shah b Malinga 9 (11b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 81.81

commentTextItems.html: no slower-ball this time: that was Malinga at pace, reversing it back into Shah who was comprehensively beaten and his stumps flayed

commentPostTextItems.html: Excellent bowling, it really has been a courageous over from Malinga....albeit a little too late

commentTextItems.html: very well bowled! A slower-ball yorker, right on the money but Shah's up to the task and blocks it out solidly

commentPostTextItems.html: Malinga doing really well here. It's so easy to lose your head in these situations

commentTextItems.html: sliced over point this time and the ball drops like a shell in the outfield

commentPreTextItems.html: So then. This ought to be the last over. Six needed from 30

commentTextItems.html: Malinga fires down a slower ball which Shah guides to point
hammered back to Fernando who parries the ball onto the non-striker's stumps

commentTextItems.html: and that could be four of them...no, a flourishing drive is saved by the extra-cover sweeper
a full toss which Shah bunts to deep point
an ugly cross-batted swipe at a half-volley. Not sure what Shah was trying to do there
better. Full and straight, Shah just comes forward patiently to defend
lovely inventive stroke, picking this from middle-and-off and forcing it through midwicket. The sweeper will collect
a tired bouncer, misdirected down the leg side
good idea - the slower ball - but Shah reads it and defends it

dismissalText.commentary: Kaushal Lokuarachchi lbw b Collingwood 9 (10b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: perfect line and length, noticeably quicker as well, and Lokuarachchi was beaten all ends up as he aimed a flick to leg. Well bowled, and the umpire's finger was up with Shakoor Rana-esque speed. That was plumb

dismissalText.commentary: Chaminda Vaas c Pietersen b Sidebottom 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: a low inswinging full-toss, and Sidebottom strikes! That was an attempted yorker, overpitched and Vaas was onto it in a flash. But Pietersen at short midwicket had no need to move, and toppled over backwards as the ball thudded into his chest

headshotImage.longCaption: DPMD Jayawardene headshot

dismissalComment.html: another one bites the dust! Banged in short, Jayawardene slashed hard outside off stump, but he got a fraction underneath the ball, and Stuart Broad at third man took a fine and fast catch. Problems mounting for Sri Lanka

headshotImage.longCaption: TM Dilshan headshot

dismissalComment.html: full length, nearly a yorker, and that's the end of that. Dilshan went to mow a meadow, missed, and was bowled through his legs. Still, a useful little cameo

dismissalText.commentary: Owais Shah b Malinga 9 (11b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: no slower-ball this time: that was Malinga at pace, reversing it back into Shah who was comprehensively beaten and his stumps flayed

stories.title: Collingwood targets further glory
stories.subTitle: England in Sri Lanka 2007-08
stories.summary: England's victorious one-day captain, Paul Collingwood, believes his team's series win in Sri Lanka is just the beginning

stories.title: 'England outplayed us' - Jayawardene
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka captain says batsmen let them down
stories.summary: Sri Lankan captain Mahela Jayawardene said the series was lost as team did not bat as a unit

stories.title: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.subTitle: October 10, 2007
stories.summary: Match home for the fourth one-day international between Sri Lanka and England in Colombo

stories.title: Cook serves up series glory for England
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.summary: England's rapidly maturing one-day side secured a historic series win with a five-wicket win in Colombo to claim their first limited-overs series success in Sri Lanka and first significant victory in the subcontinent for 20 years

stories.title: Collingwood focused on task ahead
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 4th ODI, Colombo
stories.summary: England are one win away from their first one-day series success in the sub-continent for 20 years and another notable inclusion in Paul Collingwood's young captaincy CV
